content.p: For each statement below, decide if it is true for the sympathetic nervous system, parasympathetic nervous system, both, or neither.

question.body: Preganglionic neurons originate in the lateral horn of the spinal cord

response.feedback: Incorrect. The sympathetic nervous system is not the only part of the autonomic nervous system with preganglionic neurons that originate in the lateral horn of the spinal cord.
Incorrect. The parasympathetic nervous system is not the only part of the autonomic nervous system with preganglionic neurons that originate in the lateral horn of the spinal cord.
Correct. Preganglionic neurons originate in the lateral horn of the spinal cord for both the sympathetic and parasympathetic nervous systems

Incorrect. At least one of the subdivisions of the autonomic nervous system—sympathetic or parasympathetic nervous systems—have preganglionic neurons that originate in the lateral horn of the spinal cord.

part.hint: Preganglionic neurons originate within the central nervous system.

question.body: Preganglionic neurons reside in the cerebral cortex

response.feedback: Incorrect. All sources of preganglionic neurons in the sympathetic nervous system are in the spinal cord.
Incorrect. Sources of preganglionic neurons in the parasympathetic nervous system are in the brainstem or at sacral levels of spinal cord.
Incorrect. Sources of autonomic nervous system preganglionic neurons do not arise above the level of the brainstem in the brain.
Correct. No sources of preganglionic neurons are present above brainstem level in the brain.

part.hint: Neural sources of input to the autonomic nervous system are at automatic, subconscious levels of brain.
The highest central nervous system level for sources of input to the autonomic nervous system is at brainstem level.

question.body: Postganglionic neurons lie within the lateral horn of spinal cord levels T1-L2

response.feedback: Incorrect. Postganglionic neurons in the sympathetic nervous nervous system originate in the chain or in the collateral (prevertebral) ganglia.
Incorrect. Postganglionic neurons in the parasympathetic nervous system originate at or near their target organs.
Incorrect. Postganglionic neurons originate outside of the central nervous system.
Correct. Postganglionic neurons are part of the peripheral nervous system. They would not reside in the lateral horn of the spinal cord, which is part of the central nervous system.

part.hint: All postganglionic neurons have their cell bodies within ganglia in the peripheral nervous system.
The lateral horn of the spinal cord is part of the central nervous system.

response.feedback: Correct. Collateral (prevertebral) ganglia contain sympathetic postganglionic neurons.
Incorrect. Parasympathetic nervous system does not have prevertebral ganglia.
Incorrect. Parasympathetic nervous system does not have prevertebral ganglia.
Incorrect. At least one of the divisions of the autonomic nervous system—sympathetic or parasympathetic—contains collater (prevertebral) ganglia.

part.hint: Prevertebral ganglia lie in front of (anterior to) the vertebral column and are counterparts to the sympathetic chain ganglia.

question.body: Preganglionic neurons lie in the midbrain, pons, and medulla

response.feedback: Incorrect. Preganglion neurons in the sympathetic nervous system originate from thoracic and lumbar levels of the spinal cord.
Correct. Preganglionic neurons in the parasympathetic nervous system are in the brainstem and in the lateral horn of the spinal cord at sacral levels.
Incorrect. Preganglion neurons in the sympathetic nervous system originate from thoracic and lumbar levels of the spinal cord.
Incorrect. At least one of the autonomic nervous system divisions—sympathetic or parasympathetic—have preganglionic neurons that originate in the brainstem.

part.hint: Preganglionic neurons originating in the cranium give parasympathetic nervous system the name craniosacral division of the autonomic nervous system.

question.body: Postganglionic neurons originate at or within target organs

response.feedback: Incorrect. Postganglionic neurons in the sympathetic nervous system lie either in sympathetic chain ganglia or in collateral (prevertebral) ganglia.
Correct. Postganglionic neurons in the parasympathetic nervous originate at or near the target organs.
Incorrect. Postganglionic neurons in the sympathetic nervous system have long axons.
Incorrect. At least one of the divisions of the autonomic nervous system—sympathetic or parasympathetic—have postganglionics that originates at or within target organs.

part.hint: Preganglionic neurons in the parasympathetic nervous system have long axons.

question.body: Postganglionic neurons are arranged as a chain along side the spinal vertebral column

response.feedback: Correct. At the upper thoracic levels, postganglionic neurons of the sympathetic nervous system are arranged vertically alongside the vertebral column.
Incorrect. Parasympathetic postganglionic neurons are not arranged in chains; rather, they originate at or near their target organs.
Incorrect. Parasympathetic postganglionic neurons are not arranged in chains; rather, they originate at or near their target organs.
Incorrect. At least one of the divisions of the autonomic nervous system—sympathethic or parasympathetic—has its postganglionic neurons arranged as chains.

part.hint: Sympathetic chain ganglia are sometimes referred to as paravertebral ganglia.

question.body: Preganglionic neurons originate in the lateral horn of the spinal cord levels S1-S2

response.feedback: Incorrect. Sympathetic preganglionic neurons originate in the lateral horn of the spinal cord at levels T1-L2.
Correct. Preganglionic neurons in the parasympathetic nervous system originate in the brainstem and at the sacral levels of the spinal cord.
Incorrect. Sympathetic preganglionic neurons originate in the lateral horn of the spinal cord at levels T1-L2.

Incorrect. At least one of the divisions of the autonomic nervous system—sympathetic or parasympathetic—has preganglionic neurons that originate in the lateral horn of the spinal cord at sacral levels.

part.hint: Only one of the divisions of the autonomic nervous system—sympathetic or parasympathetic—has preganglionic neurons that originate in the sacral region of the spinal cord.
